io.github.aetherv.demo

Class DemoLoginRegister

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.aetherv.demo.DemoLoginRegister

  • public class DemoLoginRegister
extends Object
    Connection to a specific database to login and register. This is a demo and should be treated as such. It is likely that there are mistakes in here, that may cause vulnerabilities. It should serve as a general idea of how you could possibly implement the following methods.


    Created using the following commands. The user we shall be using only has access to the Insert and Select functions (for security)
    USER: "demouser"
    PASS: "demopassword"

    1)
    create database demowebsite;
    2)
    CREATE TABLE demowebsite.userdb (
    ID INT NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT,
    Username VARCHAR(30) NOT NULL,
    Email VARCHAR(30) NOT NULL,
    Firstname VARCHAR(30) NOT NULL,
    Surname VARCHAR(30) NOT NULL,
    Birthday DATE NOT NULL,
    PasswordHash VARCHAR(400) NOT NULL,
    Salt VARCHAR(64) NOT NULL,
    PRIMARY KEY (ID)
    );

    • Constructor Detail

      • DemoLoginRegister

        public DemoLoginRegister(ConnectionInterface server,
                         Encryption encrypt,
                         String table)
                  throws SQLException
        Init. variables
        Parameters:
        server - What kind of server shall we be using. Shall be an Object implementing ConnectionInterface
        encrypt - What Encryption algorithm shall we be using. Shall be an Object implementing Encryption
        table - Which table shall we use in the database. Either the db shall be specified in the URL or you specify it in the table.
        Throws:
        SQLException - Most likely SQL Database Login Exception.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)

        Main method. Contains a database login sequence, followed by choice between login and register
        Login:
        Checks if the data would allow for a login and returns the authentication status via console
        Register:
        Registers yourself in the DB presuming user and emails are unique.
        Parameters:
        args - Does nothing so just leave blank

      • getString

        private static String getString(String question)
        Help Method For Main and subclasses
        Parameters:
        question - String which contains the question that shall be asked before awaiting a response (Scanner.next())
        Returns:
        User Input via Scanner.next()

      • login

        public boolean login(String usr,
                     String pwd)
              throws SQLException,
                     FieldNotFoundException
        Checks and verifies if the username and password is found in the specified table
        Parameters:
        usr - Username of person to be logged in
        pwd - Password of person to be logged in
        Returns:
        If the data matches that of the usr in the database, return true, else false
        Throws:
        SQLException - Probably an error amongst the lines of, user not found in the table
        FieldNotFoundException - Field specified,in this case "Username" does not exist in the table, aka you messed up the setup of the server

      • register

        public void register(String username,
                     String email,
                     String firstname,
                     String lastname,
                     Date birthday,
                     String password)
              throws SQLException,
                     FieldNotFoundException,
                     AlreadyRegisteredException
        Registers a user into the table using the Insert SQL command.
        Parameters:
        username - The Username by which the user wished to be known by.
        email - The users email address.
        firstname - The users first name.
        lastname - The users surname.
        birthday - The users birthday.
        password - The users password.
        Throws:
        SQLException - SQL error regarding either the Insertion of data into the table.
        FieldNotFoundException - Table misconfiguration. The fields "Username" or "Email" do not exist in the table
        AlreadyRegisteredException - The given username or email are already found within the table.

      • fields

        private ArrayList<String> fields()
                          throws SQLException
        Help method that lists all fields of the table. This is to help prevent SQL Injects, hopefully :D
        Returns:
        An ArrayList containing all the fields of the table, in the correct order.
        Throws:
        SQLException - Should not be triggered, but if it does, it is most likely because the table is empty or doesn't exist.

      • hasDuplicates

        private boolean hasDuplicates(String toSearch,
                              String Field)
                       throws SQLException,
                              FieldNotFoundException
        Help method that checks whether or not a given String is found within a field.
        Parameters:
        toSearch - The String that should be verified, whether or not it is unique to a field.
        Field - The Field in which should be checked.
        Returns:
        True if the String toSearch is unique within its field
        Throws:
        SQLException - Some sort of SQL error, probably involving data types. (If this is triggered at all)
        FieldNotFoundException - Field is not found within the table

      • find

        private String find(String identifier,
                    String idField,
                    String contentField)
             throws FieldNotFoundException,
                    SQLException
        Help method that finds a given field based off of a unique identifier. IMPORTANT: THIS METHOD DOES NOT CHECK IF THE FIELD IS A UNIQUE IDENTIFIER, IT WILL SIMPLY RETURN THE TOPMOST VALUE. As I suck at explaining: Say you wish to find the username based off of an email address, find("dory@finding.com", "Email", "Username") would do that.
        Parameters:
        identifier - A unique identifier of the data, ie. an Email, User or Primary Key
        idField - A unique value that is present within the identifier.
        contentField - The content that you wish to find.
        Returns:
        Given data of content field.
        Throws:
        FieldNotFoundException - Field that you entered does not exist in the table.
        SQLException - An Error based off of the SQL method being invalid.
